examination.instruction: Choose one correct option from the following options
examination.subject: chemical pathology

options.option: Triglycerides
Two fatty acids
Phosphoric acid linked to nitrogenous base
Cholesterol linked to nitrogenous base
none of these
are classified according to chain length
are not bound to protein in plasma
are the most metabolically active lipid fraction
are influenced by the amount of glucose available for oxidation
is a steroid
has hormonal activity
is found exclusively in animals and humans
is synthesized totally in the liver
is present in blood mainly as esters with long chain fatty acids
bonds covalently with glycine and taurine from bile salts
is absorbed in the terminal ileum
present in intestine is in the esterified form
an intestine is hydrolyzed by pancreatic esteeases
is a precursor of steroid hormones
are mostly synthesized in the liver
act as transpotting agent for free fatty acids c, require apolipoproteins A-1 for its metabolis
require apolipoproteins A-1 for its metabolism
are rich in triglycerides
show the fastest movement in the electrophoresis
when internalized is degraded to free cholesterol
is formed by hepatic delipidation of VLDL
requires apoliprotein A-II as a recognition protein for binding to specific receptors
increase is demonstrated by an intense pre-beta band at electrophoresis
could be elevated in blood due to absent or deficient receptor
type 1 is associated with increased chylomicrons
type 2 is associated with increased HDL
type 3 is associated with increased LDL
type 4 is associated with increased VLDL
type 5 is associated with increased VLDL and chylomicrons

question.text: The following findings are associated with Fredericksons Type 1 hyperlipoproteinemia

options.option: lipoprotein electrophoresis show intense band at origin
total cholesterol concentration is very high
patients present with itchy yellow nodules on skin
the disorder is common and found in the elderly
the major cause of this disorder is due to deficiency of lipoprotein lipase

question.text: Type II hyperlipoproteinemia is associated with the following

options.option: marked increase in LDL cholesterol
chronic renal failure
diabetes
marked increase in VLDL I sub classification IIa
diet low in saturated fat
marked hypercholesterolemia
LDL cholesterol which is predominant
presence of enlarged orange tonsils
corneal opacity and hepatosplenomegaly
almost absent HDL cholesterol

question.text: In galactosemia individuals are unable to metabolise galactose

options.option: due to the deficiency of lactase
due to deficiency of galactokinas
due to deficiency of uridyl transferase
and result in accumulation of glucose-1-phosphate in tissues
and result in accumulation of galactose-1-phosphate in tissues

question.text: In galactosaemia the following metabolites accumulate

options.option: dulcitol
NADPH
Glucose-1-phosphate
Galactose-1-phosphate
NADP

question.text: During the fed state, extracellular glucose is maintained by

options.option: Glycogenesis
glucose push by insulin to Brain
glucose push by insulin to muscle
the conversion of glucose to glucose-6-phosphate catalysed by glucokinase
the conversion of glucose to triglcerides and stored
